author: Special Correspondent
text:
Uncivilised behaviour of devotees attending temple festivals is turning many parts of forest areas into a dump yard.

There are lots of temples in the Niligiris North Forest Division in Sigur, Singara, and Moyar ranges which are very close to the Mudumalai Tiger Reserve.

The festivals in these temples have attracted thousands of devotees.

The Forest Department rarely check vehicles carrying devotees to these temples for plastic items. The major temples in the area are Bokkapuram Mariamman Temple, Anaikatty temple, Anikal temple, and Siryur temple.

Among them, the Bokkapuram temple comes under the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department.

Siryur village has more than six vulture nests.

The place is frequented by hyenas, and wild dogs too.

Earlier, NGOs used to clean up the area after temple festival.
title: Sigur becoming a dump yard
